climate.description: Variable conditions with heat and wind possible.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads through rolling Texas grasslands. 100-mile distance with moderate elevation.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional TX event. 100 miles is significant but rolling grasslands terrain and regional field.

biased_opinion.summary: Grasslands 100 is a 100-mile gravel race in Decatur, Texas—rolling grasslands with moderate elevation. The 100-mile distance is the main challenge, but it's rolling grasslands terrain with a regional field, keeping it in Tier 3. Decatur provides moderate access. Spring/fall weather brings heat and wind challenges.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid 100-mile gravel challenge with rolling grasslands. Worth it for the distance challenge. Not a destination race for terrain variety or field depth.

final_verdict.should_you_race: If you want a 100-mile challenge—yes, it's a solid distance test. If you want terrain variety or pro field depth—look elsewhere.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better century events: Land Run 100. For similar regional events: other TX gravel races.

logistics.food: Decatur has moderate dining options. Stock nutrition for 100 miles.
logistics.camping: Camping Area within the Grasslands park area, near the intersection of FS Road 900 and FS 904

course_description.signature_challenge: 100-mile distance through Texas grasslands with heat and wind.

non_negotiables.why: 100 miles requires extensive endurance base and long-distance preparation.
TX spring/fall means heat and wind are likely.

logistics.explanation: DFW airport puts you within an hour of TADRA Point Camping Area at the intersection of FS Road 900 and FS 904. Start time is 8:30 AM with packet pickup details still unclear from available sources.

length.explanation: Glenn McRill attempted his first 100-mile race here "with less-than-ideal training," bringing years of marathon experience as Director of Coaching for the San Antonio RoadRunners. The 30-hour cutoff provides generous time for the century distance. Longer than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

technicality.explanation: The course requires crossing streams, running through muddy bogs, sand, and underbrush on non-technical equestrian trails. Many runners earn PRs on what organizers call the "flat, non-technical course" shared with horses and livestock. Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: Rolling grasslands with moderate elevation gain spread across 100 miles through the LBJ National Grasslands. The gentle profile has historically been "a fast race" where course conditions favor personal records. Less climbing than The Mid South.

climate.explanation: Historical weather data shows average highs of 71°F and lows of 50°F, with a 41% chance of rain on any given day. March conditions show expected highs of 68° and lows of 42° with an 8:30 AM start. Late March in North Texas means unpredictable weather during tornado season with potential temperature swings. More weather exposure than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

altitude.explanation: Decatur, Texas sits around 1,000-1,200 feet above sea level in the North Texas grasslands. Altitude isn't a factor at these low elevations. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds — no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: Over 20,000 acres in the Caddo and LBJ National Grasslands with wildlife viewing, hunting, fishing, and horseback riding terrain. The remote backcountry setting offers no water sources or electricity beyond aid stations.

prestige.explanation: This is fundamentally the Grasslands Trail Run, a running ultramarathon that's been around since 1999. The 100-mile distance was added after 25 years when organizers noted the course had "potential with the right conditions and athletes."

race_quality.explanation: Organized by Blaze Trails using four color-coded loop sections (Yellow, Blue, Red, White) starting from TADRA Point. Aid stations provide water and sports drinks, with hot food available at night for 100-mile participants.

experience.explanation: Seth ran the event as part of a competitive field, though his full race report remains incomplete in available sources. The multi-distance format includes 100-mile, 50-mile, marathon, half marathon, and 15K options with staggered starts.

community.explanation: Regional field of 100-500 participants gathering for this North Texas trail running tradition held annually the third weekend in March. The area serves hunters, anglers, mountain bikers, and campers beyond the racing community.

field_depth.explanation: With a field of 200-400 riders, the field draws regional trail runners rather than elite gravel cyclists. Glenn McRill's attempt as an experienced marathon runner and coaching director represents the competitive level typically seen at this event. Less competitive depth than Almanzo 100.

value.explanation: Access to over 20,000 acres of protected grassland with aid station support and night services for longer distances. Entry fees remain undisclosed, but the remote setting and multi-distance options provide substantial course access.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $80-120. DFW airport access keeps travel reasonable, about an hour from the TADRA Point start area. North Texas lodging and food costs stay moderate, though specific accommodation options near the grasslands remain unclear. Similar expense level to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Vittoria Terreno Mix
primary.why: Graphene versatility. Mixed-terrain grip with reasonable rolling speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners
